timeline.bodyText: hmm.. can we throw badrequest instead of internal server error from cloudbreak side?
timeline.author: sodre90

replies.bodyText: We do not throw internal exception directly, It is a common jax-rs exception of HTTP code 500. But we need to handle it because the reason message was 500 internal error on the UI
replies.author: topolyai5

replies.bodyText: but why is it 500? why not something else? maybe a bad exceptionmapper?
replies.author: sodre90

replies.bodyText:
Imagine that user error when someone would like to attach an AZURE SDX to an AWS env.
Somewhere in the CB throw a ClassCastException. Should we create a mapper all of the unexpected wrong user interaction?
Sorry, my fault: in the DefaultExceptionMapper we throw an InternalServerError
replies.author: topolyai5

replies.bodyText: please use WebApplicationException (it will catch both client and server errors)
replies.author: sodre90

timeline.author: daszabo

replies.bodyText: is it better? "Can not start provisioning, some error happened on Cloudbreak side: " + errorMessage
replies.author: topolyai5

replies.bodyText:
https://www.lexico.com/grammar/cannot-or-can-not
someone prefer that format, what is the problem with that?
replies.author: topolyai5

replies.bodyText: "the first is much more usual". Users will see this and they would also think can not looks weird and unusual
replies.author: attilapalfi92

timeline.bodyText: Should we throw an exception, if the AZ list is empty? If not, at least log the fact please.
timeline.author: daszabo

replies.bodyText: Are the AZs required? Are you sure that we do not break the process with exception?
replies.author: topolyai5

replies.bodyText: Well, without an exception, the dropdown on the UI will be empty, which might also be a good enough clue for the user, that something is amiss.
replies.author: daszabo

replies.bodyText: the log message is ok for me, I will update with it
replies.author: topolyai5
